intro: Obetia carruthersiana, commonly known as the Carruthers' obetia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is herbaceous, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
